course.subject: CIVL
course.name: Introduction to Structural Dynamics
course.description: Single degree of freedom systems, multi-degree of freedom systems, continuous systems, random vibrations, dynamic behavior under wind loads and earthquakes.
course.prerequisites: CIVL 2120 AND MATH 2011 AND MATH 2350

reviews.author: alanleunghihi
reviews.comment_content:
Outline:
 Newton’s laws of motion
 Dynamics of single- degree-of-freedom systems
 Dynamics of multiple-degree-of-freedom systems
 Dynamics of continuous systems
 Introduction to Lagrange’s Equations and Hamilton’s Principle

Intended Learning Outcomes:
1) Ability to apply fundamental dynamical principles to model, obtain solutions to and interpret structural behavior under various forms of time-varying excitation for discrete SDOF and MDOF systems, as well as basic continuous systems.

2) Ability to apply modern numeric and symbolic computing tools (computer algebra systems) for efficient formulation and solution to dynamics problems.
reviews.comment_teaching:
Prof. Hu is a really nice professor. He provides students the CAS calculator which is really useful for the course and convenient when it comes to those complicated numerical equations. All those calculators are bought by himself.

His teaching style is casual, and you won't feel bored or under pressure throughout the whole lecture.
reviews.comment_grading:
The grading is great. Basically, you can easily get high marks in all the quizzes and the project. For the class participation, you can get full marks as long as you come to most of the classes.

Class participation (5%) + Quizzes (3x10 % = 30%) + Project (15%) + Final exam (50%) = 100%
reviews.comment_workload:
Three In-class Quizzes
1 Project (Submit before the final exam or after)
1 Final Exam

reviews.author: MSY
reviews.comment_content: Quite good, this course  will be offered again in Spring 2021, they will have very limited quota for those backlogged students, so better take this course in fall sem.
